com.poesys.bs.delegate
Interface IDataDelegate<T extends IDto<S>,S extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto,K extends com.poesys.db.pk.IPrimaryKey>

Type Parameters:
T - the business layer DTO type
S - the data-access layer DTO type
K - the primary key type
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDataDelegate, AbstractIdentityDataDelegate
public interface IDataDelegate<T extends IDto<S>,S extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto,K extends com.poesys.db.pk.IPrimaryKey>

An interface for the business delegates in the application that require a database connection and managed transactions.

The primary goal of the Data Delegate is to proxy the business-level services for the presentation layer based on a persistent database layer. The concrete implementation will implement the methods for all the required services, mostly supplying SQL objects. Such methods should use business-layer data transfer objects (DTOs) to move data in and out of the system (type parameter T). These DTOs provide object data and services to the user interface layer and are thus different from the DTOs in the data access layer (type parameter S). The business delegate gets data using data-access-layer DTOs and transforms these DTOs into the business layer DTOs (which may actually wrap a data-access DTO as its internal implementation).

The interface permits a delegate factory to generate objects of an appropriate implementation given the target data access layer (for example, there could be separate implementations for JDBC access, EJB access, or JMS access to data). The UI layer uses the interface to access the services implemented by the concrete implementation.

It will often be the case that you add services to the delegate in a specific application beyond those supported here. If so, subclass this interface with a more specific interface that contains the additional services and write a factory to generate the appropriate concrete implementations of the sub-interface.

Author:
Robert J. Muller

Method Detail

getObject

T getObject(K key)
                            throws DelegateException
Query an object of type T based on its primary key values.

Parameters:
key - the primary key of the object to query
Returns:
an object of type T or null if no object matches the key
Throws:
DelegateException - when there is a database problem, an invalid primary key, a nested-object query problem, or a problem setting initial object status

getAllObjects

java.util.List<T> getAllObjects(int rows)
                                                throws DelegateException
Get a list of all the TestNatural objects in the database.

Parameters:
rows - the number of rows to fetch at once, optimizes large queries; 0 means the default
Returns:
a list of TestNatural objects
Throws:
DelegateException - when there is a constraint violation, a problem with executing the query, a problem with nested-object queries, or a problem assigning initial DTO status

process

void process(java.util.List<T> list)
             throws DelegateException
Process a list of TestNatural objects in various statuses. The method will insert, update, or delete objects in the list based on each object's status.

Parameters:
list - the list of TestNatural objects
Throws:
DelegateException - when there is a problem processing the objects

truncateTable

void truncateTable(java.lang.String tableName)
                   throws DelegateException
Truncate a table, removing all rows. This is a Data Definition Language statement that will commit any open transaction.

Parameters:
tableName - the name of the table to truncate
Throws:
DelegateException - when there is a SQL exception on the attempt to truncate the table
